conclusion: The frame is a square with side length l, the magnetic field has a width d and is uniform, the frame moves with speed v, and l < d.
An induced current occurs when the magnetic flux through the frame changes, which happens when the frame is entering or exiting the magnetic field.
The front edge of the frame starts entering the magnetic field, and the time taken for the entire frame to enter is t_enter = l/v.
Once the frame is completely inside the magnetic field, there is no change in flux until it starts to exit. The time taken to exit is t_exit = l/v.
The total time with induced current is t_total = t_enter + t_exit = 2l/v.
The time during which there is an induced current in the frame is 2l/v.
